alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Roanoke (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 09 at 3:32PM EDT until September 09 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR MONTGOMERY AND WEST CENTRAL ROANOKE COUNTIES... At 332 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Blacksburg... Christiansburg... Radford... Shawsville... Merrimac... Mc Donalds Mill... Elliston-Lafayette... This includes the following locations... Virginia Tech. This includes the following streams and drainages... Flatwoods Branch, Indian Run, Gallion Branch, Craig Creek, Catawba Creek, Elliott Creek, Brake Branch, Georges Run, Dry Run, Crab Creek and Bonys Run. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
